column4: my laptop for some reason is no longer connecting to wireless.  I've tried toggling the wireless on/off with the fn-f3(where the wireless logo is) but nothing pops up.  Yesterday there was an applet to choose wireless networks but today its missing, any ideas?
thats the fn-f3, doesn't have a physical switch
iwconfig shows wlan1 is on
rfkill list
hmm, soft blocked: no  hard blocked: yes
which would imply it does have a physical switch?
i cant find a physical swithc anywhere, had this laptop a few months and it has very few switches(acer aspire 7750g)
actually, toggling fn-f3 (i guess i hadn't hit it enough times) turns off hard blocked: no
but i still dont have an applet or a way to choose a wireless network, can it be run from the command line?
What does, sudo iwlist wlan0 scan
about 10 pages of Cell 01 - stuff, Cell 02 - stuff, down to cell 29
sudo service network-manager restart
just says restarting, but no visible changes and iwconfig doesn't show wlan1 connect to anything
What about applet
no applet, i killed nm-applet and restarted it, it runs but doesn't display anything on the top bar
Is it unity?
maverick
pre-unity
Alt-F2 and gnome-panel --replace
replaces the top bar, but still no applet :S  very odd
other applets are there (dropbox, battery, sound, clock, messaging, power button)
Did you try to add it (right click on panel)? Also: nmcli con list)
found it, for some reason there was no 'notifation area' applet, got deleted on way or another
thanks
